meanings.definition: To retire or become ineligible for active duty due to old age or infirmity.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather had to superannuate from his job last year.
meanings.sent2: Many people superannuate from work after reaching a certain age.
meanings.sent3: It's time for the old computer to superannuate and make way for a new one.
meanings.sent4: The worn-out shoes decided to superannuate themselves after years of service.
meanings.sent5: The retired teacher superannuated gracefully, leaving behind a legacy of knowledge.

meanings.definition: To set aside or reserve for a specific purpose in the future.
meanings.sent1: We need to superannuate some funds for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent2: It's wise to superannuate some time each day for self-care.
meanings.sent3: I will superannuate this book for when I have more free time to read.
meanings.sent4: She decided to superannuate her favorite dress for a special occasion.
meanings.sent5: Let's superannuate some snacks for the road trip tomorrow.
